contentrichtext.text: {{unreferenced|date=June 2008}} Philosophers and psychologists are described as being '''neo-[[Cartesianism|Cartesian]]''' if they posit 'mind stuff' as being different from 'brain stuff' and if they posit 'internal cognitive states' as having causal powers. Some philosophers (e.g. [[Hubert Dreyfus]]) have argued that [[artificial intelligence]] theories (and [[Cognitivism (psychology)|cognitivist]] theories generally), for all their alleged 'materialism', are actually neo-Cartesian. {{philosophy-stub}} [[Category:Philosophical schools and traditions]]
